"'Let's get out some paper "'and write down all the pros over here "'and all the cons over here "'and we're just really gonna kind of put out a fleece "'and so on and so forth.'" No, no, Jacob is communicating to Rachel and Leah what God has told him to do. God said, arise and return. And when he was so convinced of what God's plan was and he was able to effectively communicate, here's what God has instructed me to do, there's this response, "'Whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do.'" And I like that. Because the reality is that if God's told you to do something, if God's told me to do something, we better obey God. We think about decisions that we make in our lives. Times have gone in the past where people will come and seek to counsel with me. It's not just me, but obviously, people have counseled with pastors over the years. And there are times in which I have said, and I know others have as well through conversation that I've had with them, something like this. If that's what God's told you to do, then you better do it. Why? Because I'm not trying to get in the way of God. Amen? And when God gives us that clarity, when God reveals to us His plan and He communicates with us, and then we're able to communicate that plan that God has for our lives to others, we can garner their support. I think about Brother Baloo this morning. Do you have any doubt in your mind that God's called him to Idaho? No doubt in my mind whatsoever. I mean, if he got up here and was presenting his ministry and just kind of like, well, you know, I'm just kind of gonna try it out and see this and that, know, I'm kind of keeping my, I'm not, I'm not sure that God's clearly communicated to you because you're obviously not able to clearly communicate to us what God's called you to do. But Jacob is able to stand and rehearse. And it's because in that time of difficulty and that time of adversity after the Bible speaks about his increasing greatly that the Lord spoke to him. I hope this evening that we'd hold tight to the promises of God. I hope this evening that we would understand the reality of His presence and that we would be encouraged and comforted through the truth of His presence, that God does have a plan, that He is aware of your circumstance, of your situation, and that everything that we encounter in life, God's in control. There are times in which we say, it's all falling apart. How in the world? God's in control. God has a purpose. God has a plan. And He delivers us through and He strengthens us. And there are times as we look at the truth of 2 Corinthians 1 that we are comforted by the God of all comfort so that we then can comfort others with the same comfort that we have received. And that's a great truth of ministry within the household of faith. Let's pray. Father, we love You. We thank You for loving us. We thank You for this passage of Scripture. And as we overview these circumstances, these events that lead to the departure of Jacob from that land to go back to Canaan, it's more than just historical fact that is provided. There is precious truth that You've revealed that encourages even us this evening. I'm thankful that as we've looked at these promises and these realities in the life of Jacob that we can understand that these truths are applicable in our lives as well. I pray that You'd help us to rest in Thee. Lord, help us to listen for the voice of God through Your precious book that You would reveal to us Your plan. That we'd say, even as Samuel of old said, speak Lord, for Thy servant heareth. The idea of that word is to hear with the intent of obedience. God, I pray that You'd encourage Your people this evening through this passage of Scripture as we've highlighted some of these wonderful promises. We claim them for our own. We'd go out with renewed vision and passion to serve You, to make a difference in this lost and dying world. We commit these moments to You and ask that You'd move and work as only You can. For it's in Christ's name we pray.
